channel.title: film on Reviews Per Minute
channel.description: Recent content in film on Reviews Per Minute

item.title: Eo - 86 mins
item.description: EO directed by Jerzy Skolimowski uses the language of cinema to push us to empathise with a non-human protagonist and therefore expand our sense of subjectivity to cover the perspective of its titular donkey.

item.title: The Bonfire of the Vanities - 125 mins
item.description: If you set out to purposefully miscast a film, you couldn’t do a better job than THE BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES did inadvertently.

item.title: Klute - 114 mins
item.description: A great performance from Jane Fonda as a sex worker whose reward for navigating a paranoid world of shadowy figures and sexual assault is to end up with John Klute (Donald Sutherland), the most boring man alive.

item.title: Lost Hearts - 35 mins
item.description: Not my favourite of Lawrence Gordon Clark’s Ghost Stories for Christmas, LOST HEARTS is altogether too literal. Adaptations of James work best when the haunting is diffuse, unknowable, and tied to the ghost of England.

item.title: Glengarry Glen Ross - 100 mins
item.description: Like THE BANSHEES OF INISHERIN, GLENGARRY GLEN ROSS feels like a play in that it’s carried by its terrific dialogue and performances.
